formulas.name: Hydrostatic Pressure
formulas.formula: P (psi) = MW (ppg) × 0.052 × TVD (ft)

variables.MW: Mud weight in pounds per gallon

formulas.name: Pressure Gradient
formulas.formula: Gradient (psi/ft) = MW (ppg) × 0.052

formulas.name: Fluid Density from Pressure
formulas.formula: MW (ppg) = Hydrostatic P (psi) ÷ (TVD (ft) × 0.052)

formulas.name: Formation Pressure
formulas.formula: Formation P (psi) = Hydrostatic P in drillstring (psi) + SIDPP (psi)
formulas.notes: Use this to determine actual formation pressure after shut-in

formulas.name: Pump Output
formulas.formula: Output (bbl/min) = Pump Displacement (bbl/stroke) × SPM

formulas.name: Equivalent Circulating Density
formulas.formula: ECD (ppg) = MW (ppg) + (Annular Pressure Loss (psi) ÷ (TVD (ft) × 0.052))
formulas.notes: ECD is always higher than static MW due to friction

formulas.name: Fluid Density with Trip Margin
formulas.formula: Effective MW (ppg) = MW (ppg) + (Trip Margin (psi) ÷ (TVD (ft) × 0.052))

formulas.name: New Pump Pressure (Rate Change)
formulas.formula: New P (psi) = Current P (psi) × (New SPM ÷ Current SPM)²
formulas.notes: Pressure varies with the SQUARE of pump rate

formulas.name: New Pump Pressure (Density Change)
formulas.formula: New P (psi) = Current P (psi) × (New MW (ppg) ÷ Current MW (ppg))

formulas.name: Maximum Allowable Fluid Density
formulas.formula: Max MW (ppg) = LOT MW (ppg) + (Surface LOT P (psi) ÷ (Shoe TVD (ft) × 0.052))

formulas.name: MAASP
formulas.formula: MAASP (psi) = (Max MW (ppg) - Current MW (ppg)) × 0.052 × Shoe TVD (ft)
formulas.notes: Maximum pressure before fracturing the shoe

formulas.name: Kill Fluid Density
formulas.formula: Kill MW (ppg) = Current MW (ppg) + (SIDPP (psi) ÷ (TVD (ft) × 0.052))

formulas.name: Initial Circulating Pressure
formulas.formula: ICP (psi) = SCR Pressure (psi) + SIDPP (psi)

formulas.name: Final Circulating Pressure
formulas.formula: FCP (psi) = (Kill MW (ppg) ÷ Current MW (ppg)) × SCR Pressure (psi)

formulas.name: Gas Migration Rate
formulas.formula: Migration Rate (ft/hr) = Pressure Increase (psi/hr) ÷ (MW (ppg) × 0.052)

formulas.name: Pressure Drop per Foot - Dry Pipe
formulas.formula: (MW × 0.052 × Metal Disp) ÷ (Casing Cap - Metal Disp)

formulas.name: Pressure Drop per Foot - Wet Pipe
formulas.formula: (MW × 0.052 × Closed End Disp) ÷ (Casing Cap - Closed End Disp)

formulas.name: Level Drop - Collars Out Dry
formulas.formula: (Length of Collars × Metal Disp) ÷ Casing Cap

formulas.name: Level Drop - Collars Out Wet
formulas.formula: (Length of Collars × Closed End Disp) ÷ Casing Cap

formulas.name: Length to Pull Dry Before Losing Overbalance
formulas.formula: (Overbalance × (Casing Cap - Metal Disp)) ÷ (MW × 0.052 × Metal Disp)

formulas.name: Length to Pull Wet Before Losing Overbalance
formulas.formula: (Overbalance × (Casing Cap - Closed End Disp)) ÷ (MW × 0.052 × Closed End Disp)

formulas.name: Volume to Bleed - Gas Migration
formulas.formula: Volume (bbl) = Working P (psi) × (Annular Cap (bbl/ft) ÷ Pressure Gradient (psi/ft))

formulas.name: Slug Volume for Dry Pipe
formulas.formula: (Dry Pipe Length × Pipe Cap × Current MW) ÷ (Slug MW - Current MW)

formulas.name: Pit Gain from Slug U-Tubing
formulas.formula: Slug Volume × ((Slug MW ÷ Current MW) - 1)

formulas.name: Riser Margin (Subsea)
formulas.formula: ((Air Gap + Water Depth) × MW) - (Water Depth × Sea Water MW)) ÷ (TVD - Air Gap - Water Depth)

formulas.name: Hydrostatic Loss if Casing Float Fails
formulas.formula: (MW × 0.052 × Casing Cap × Unfilled Height) ÷ (Casing Cap + Annular Cap)

gaugeProblems: Pressures only relevant if BELOW expected values
OR if 70+ psi ABOVE expected values
commonMistakes: Forgetting to use absolute pressure in gas calculations
Using wrong displacement (metal vs closed end)
Not squaring the rate ratio in pump pressure calculations
